author: EvolvingFromNothing
body:
Can anyone explain how a company can have a Debt-to-Equity ratio of 0, but a Long-Term-Debt-to-Equity ratio that's non zero?  For instance, KLAC:  
 [https://www.finviz.com/quote.ashx?t=KLAC&ty=c&ta=1&p=d](https://www.finviz.com/quote.ashx?t=KLAC&ty=c&ta=1&p=d) 

 Debt/Eq = 0.0

 LT Debt/Eq = 1.19

When they say Debt/Eq in this case, are they only referring to short-term debt?

author: p_giggles
body:
I'm confused, TSMC doesn't manufacture equipment, they're the biggest chip foundry in the world. If you want semi equipment stocks, look for LRCX, AMAT, KLAC, ASML, those guys. 

That's super interesting about Moore's second law though, I had no idea it existed!

author: Jwceltic5
body: Take a look at the semiconductor equipment manufacturers. LRCX, AMAT, KLAC.

author: t35t0r
body: if you're gonna do mu, you also need to tsm amat lrcx uctt avgo mrvl klac amd intc nvda stm txn adi (or just soxl and soxs, but i like curating them myself)

author: Jabbermouth
body:
#List of potential 10 baggers:

-	DEAC Calls 5/15 or 8/21
-	AIMT Calls 2/21 or 3/20
-	APT Calls 2/21
-	TSLA Calls (any expiration)
-	SPCE Calls (any expiration)

#Literally free money plays:

-	TSM Calls 4/17
-	LRCX Calls 1/31
-	KLAC Calls 2/7
-	NFLX Calls 1/31

author: barrettj44
body: Semis! Taiwan semis just gave a great report guiding cap ex to all time highs. Amat LRCX klac asml TSM AVGO NVDA qcom XLNX qrvo SWKS
